intro: [WRONG START] Erysimony evinense, commonly known as the Evinense wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are bright yellow, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. Erysimum evinense is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
